intro: Polygala tisserantii, commonly known as the Tisserant's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, with five petals that are arranged in a unique, spurred shape. Polygala tisserantii is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and evolutionary significance.
